channel.title: Recents Article on Portio
channel.description: Recent content in Recents Article on Portio

item.title: Advanced - Graph Reproduction and Analysis of GDP Components
item.description: Team members: Noor Alameri, Brigita Angkasa, Lujia Huang, Martino Armanini, Marco Laube, Deniz Oezdemir Source: Homework 3 for Applied Statistics with R by Kostis @ London Business School Key Words: skim, glimpse, ggplot, summarise, mutate, pivot_longer GDP components over time and among countries At the risk of oversimplifying things, the main components of gross domestic product, GDP are personal consumption (C), business investment (I), government spending (G) and net exports (exports - imports).

item.title: Intermediate - General Social Survey of American Media & Email Usage
item.description: Team members: Noor Alameri, Brigita Angkasa, Lujia Huang, Martino Armanini, Marco Laube, Deniz Oezdemir Source: Homework 2 for Applied Statistics with R by Kostis @ London Business School Key Words: skim, glimpse, ggplot, summarise, mutate, geom_errorbar, confidence intervals General Social Survey (GSS) The General Social Survey (GSS) gathers data on American society in order to monitor and explain trends in attitudes, behaviours, and attributes. Many trends have been tracked for decades, so one can see the evolution of attitudes, etc in American Society.

item.title: Beginner - Alcohol Consumption in Different Countries
item.description: Team members: Noor Alameri, Brigita Angkasa, Lujia Huang, Martino Armanini, Marco Laube, Deniz Oezdemir Source: Homework 1 for Applied Statistics with R by Kostis @ London Business School Key Words: skim, glimpse, ggplot Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? Back in 2014, fivethiryeight.com published an article on alcohol consumption in different countries. The data drinks is available as part of the fivethirtyeight package. Let’s load the data and have a look!

item.title: Draft - Homework 1
item.description: Where Do People Drink The Most Beer, Wine And Spirits? Back in 2014, fivethiryeight.com published an article on alcohol consumption in different countries. The data drinks is available as part of the fivethirtyeight package. Let’s load the data and have a look! library(fivethirtyeight) data(drinks) To get an idea of what the data is like, we use glimpse and skim. Furthermore, we can use ?drinks to get some more meta information.

item.title: Draft - Homework 2
item.description: Climate change and temperature anomalies We want to study climate change and gratefully find data on the Combined Land-Surface Air and Sea-Surface Water Temperature Anomalies in the Northern Hemisphere at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies. The tabular data of temperature anomalies can be found here. To define temperature anomalies, we need to have a reference, or base period, which NASA clearly states that it is the period between 1951-1980.

item.title: Draft - Homework 3
item.description: Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance Every two years, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention conduct the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System (YRBSS) survey, where it takes data from high schoolers (9th through 12th grade), to analyze health patterns. We will work with a selected group of variables from a random sample of observations during one of the years the YRBSS was conducted. Load the data This data is part of the openintro textbook and we can directly load and inspect it:
